body_text.text: It appears that two methylene groups between the phenyl ring and oxygen of 5-(3-chloro-4-benzyloxybenzylidene)thiazolidine-2,4-dione are optimal for inhibitory activity against 15-hydroxyprostaglandin dehydrogenase.

Design, synthesis and evaluation of novel 2-hydroxypyrrolobenzodiazepine-5,11-dione analogues as potent angiotensin converting enzyme ( IC 50 =0.272 µM A series of novel 2-hydroxypyrrolobenzodiazepine-5,11-dione analogues designed through structure based rational hybridization approach were synthesized. Evaluation of all 23 new compounds using ACE inhibition assay, resulted (2R,11aS)-10-((4-bromothiophen-2-yl)methyl)-2-hydroxy-2,3-dihydro-1H-benzo[e]pyrrolo[1,2-a][1,4]diazepine-5,11(10H,11aH)dione, 5v as most potent non-carboxylic acid ACE inhibitor.

Chemically modified siRNAs and miRNAs bearing urea/thiourea-bridged aromatic compounds at their 3 0 -end for RNAi therapy pp 4494-4501 Synthesis, biological evaluation, X-ray molecular structure and molecular docking studies of RGD mimetics containing 6-amino-2,3-dihydroisoindolin-1-one fragment as ligands of integrin

BIBREF0.title: Botulinum neuortoxins are the most lethal toxins known to man and are considered by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to be a ''Category A'' agent placing them as one of the six highest priority bioterrorist agents. There are no approved pharmacological treatments for botulinum neurointoxication. The work detailed combines studies using synthesis, crystallography, modeling, kinetic and cellular research to advance pharmacological intervention against this neurotoxin

BIBREF3.title: SciSearch, TOXFILE. Also covered in the abstract and citation database SciVerse Scopus Ò . Full text available on SciVerse ScienceDirect Ò

Roy, Girish K. Gupta, Sanjay M. Jachak, Jitander K. Kapoor, Pawan K. Celecoxib analogues having 1,5-diaryl relationship were synthesized by exploring bioisosteric modifications and screened for their in vivo anti-inflammatory (AI) activity as well as in vitro cyclooxygenase (COX) inhibition assays. Some of the analogues have shown excellent anti-inflammatory activity as well as COX-2 selectivity.
